function_call.name: get_risks
function_call.arguments: {"risks":[{"Description":"Limited use of AI in surgical fields may hinder the potential for quality healthcare and evidence-based clinical decision-making.","Impact":"Reduced ability to assist doctors during surgery and provide quality healthcare, potentially leading to errors in clinical decision-making.","Mitigation":"Increase the integration of AI technology with data captured by surgeons and doctors to support evidence-based clinical decision-making and workflow.","Technologies":"AI technology for capturing and integrating surgical data, machine learning algorithms for decision support.","People":"Surgeons, doctors, healthcare workers","Owner":"Healthcare institutions, AI technology developers"},{"Description":"Inability to implement AI in the surgical field for treating COVID-19 infected patients may hinder the use of AI for patient treatment and ventilator parameter adjustments.","Impact":"Lack of AI support for treating COVID-19 patients and adjusting ventilator parameters, potentially leading to less optimized patient care.","Mitigation":"Invest in research and development to explore the integration of AI in treating COVID-19 patients and adjusting ventilator parameters.","Technologies":"AI algorithms for treatment decision support, machine learning models for ventilator parameter optimization.","People":"Healthcare workers, patients","Owner":"Healthcare institutions, research and development organizations"},{"Description":"Limited utilization of AI technology in clinical trials and medicine development may slow down the process of achieving precise results and accelerating medicine and vaccine development.","Impact":"Slower progress in clinical trials and medicine development, potentially delaying effective healthcare solutions.","Mitigation":"Increase the use of AI technology for clinical trial monitoring and medicine development to accelerate the process and attain precise results.","Technologies":"AI algorithms for clinical trial monitoring, machine learning models for drug effects prediction.","People":"Researchers, healthcare professionals","Owner":"Research institutions, pharmaceutical companies"}]}
